MSELoss

Mean Squared Error Loss

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
a = torch.rand(1,2,10)
b = torch.rand(1,2,10)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
MSELoss()(a,b)

tensor(0.2124)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
MSELossFlat()(a,b)

TensorBase(0.2124)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

mse[source]

mse(inp, targ)

Mean squared error between inp and targ.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
mse(a,b)

tensor(0.2124)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert mse(a,b) == MSELoss()(a,b)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert mse(a,b) == MSELossFlat()(a,b)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
Module

fastai.torch_core.Module
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class MSE_[source]

MSE_() :: Module

Same as nn.Module, but no need for subclasses to call super().__init__

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

MSE_.forward[source]

MSE_.forward(a, b)

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

.. note:: Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the :class:Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
MSE_()(a,b)

tensor(0.2124)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert MSE_()(a,b) == MSELoss()(a,b)
{% endraw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def log_softmax_(a):
    o = a.exp()/a.exp().sum(1).unsqueeze(-1)
    return o.log()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
log_softmax_(a)

-a[range(len(a)), b]

tensor([-0.6993, -0.0908,  0.7443, -0.6316, -0.1970,  0.8089, -0.6035, -0.0561])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def nll_(a,b):
    o = a[range(len(a)), b]
    return -o
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
nll_(log_softmax_(a),b)

tensor([1.3694, 2.0855, 2.2262, 1.6877, 1.2745, 2.6661, 1.3712, 2.4655])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
torch.nn.functional.nll_loss(torch.nn.functional.log_softmax(a),b, reduction="none")

CrossEntropyLoss()(a,b)

tensor(1.8933)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def ce(a,b): return nll_(log_softmax_(a),b).mean()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ce(a,b)

tensor(1.8933)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert ce(a,b) == CrossEntropyLoss()(a,b)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert ce(a,b) == CrossEntropyLossFlat()(a,b)

BCE

Binary Cross Entropy

{% raw %} 
from torch.nn.functional import binary_cross_entropy, binary_cross_entropy_with_logits
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
a = torch.randn((3, 2))
a

tensor([[ 0.0323,  1.3236],
        [ 1.7825, -1.1676],
        [-0.9347,  0.8102]])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
b= tensor([[1,0],[1,0],[0,1]]).float(); b

tensor([[1., 0.],
        [1., 0.],
        [0., 1.]])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sa = sigmoid(a)
sa

tensor([[0.5081, 0.7898],
        [0.8560, 0.2373],
        [0.2820, 0.6922]])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
binary_cross_entropy(sa,b)

tensor(0.5604)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
binary_cross_entropy_with_logits(a,b)

tensor(0.5604)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
-torch.where(b==1., sa, 1-sa).log()

tensor([[0.6771, 1.5596],
        [0.1555, 0.2709],
        [0.3313, 0.3679]])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
binary_cross_entropy(sa,b,reduction='none')

tensor([[0.6771, 1.5596],
        [0.1555, 0.2709],
        [0.3313, 0.3679]])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def bce(a,b):
    return -torch.where(b==1., sa, 1-sa).log().mean()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
bce(sa,b) 

tensor(0.5604)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert bce(sa,b)==binary_cross_entropy(sa,b)
{% endraw %}
